name: The Peninsula Bangkok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ended our honeymoon tour of Thailand with a 2 night stay at The Peninsula Bangkok and I wish we could have stayed longer! Excellent service, amazingly spacious and well equipped suite, great spa, and delicious breakfast in the morning. The location is excellent with easy access to sky train and shuttle boats to hotels and sights on other side of river. We will definitely be back!
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel for relaxing. Totally recommended.
reviews.title: Hotel for relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights and we loved it.
reviews.title: A place to come back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Big luxury room, bathroom with 2 sinks (nice ), free shuttle boat (across the river to the main area of Bangkok)
reviews.title: Could not be better!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Breakfast was good, with river view.
reviews.title: Opulence to the max

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I always love staying at the Peninsula.We had a airport pickup in one of the Hotels vehicles.(highly recommended) This time I shared a suite with a friend. It was nice to come back to a quiet environment, and view of the river after a day of shopping in chaotic Bangkok.
reviews.title: Fantastic Spa and Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very large international buffet breakfast served at the riverside restaurant. Pool area is amazingly peaceful with a great menu for a quick lunch. Was not impressed by the Chinese restaurant. Room service was efficient and very good.
reviews.title: Worth the extra cost to stay on the upper floors

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Easy access to the water taxi's, or take the Hotels water taxi across the river to connect with a ferry or Sky train. I like to avoid driving in Bangkok if at all possible, as the traffic is horrible.
reviews.title: Nice hotel - inconvenient location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: The spa is a little piece of heaven, the best I have ever experienced....no wonder it still gets rave reviews!! (Skip the first part though, steam room and spa in the locker room).
reviews.title: Benchmark for other hotels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall still a lovely place to stay...I will be back.
reviews.title: by the river

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 6 nights in the Peninsula.It was the first time in an hotel of the Peninsula Brand. Our touroperator arranged a free upgrade to a suite.
reviews.title: no WOW experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Room was large and comfortable . ( 2 toilets, 2 tv's ) We had a beautiful view on the river and the city at the 17 floor.
reviews.title: Believe it or not the Pen is a value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel is very clean. Check in was quick but very cool. You have to stand at the front desk, no drinks, no cool towel.No warming welcome.
reviews.title: A near perfect hotel but not quite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Concierge desk is very helpfull .
reviews.title: PEACE AND QUIET IN BANGKOK!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was a good choise and food was ok, but every morning the same.
reviews.title: Couldnt have been any better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Peninsula hotel is an unmissable landmark on the Bangkok riverside area; a monolithic sky scraper and one of the tallest buildings in the City. I stayed there for four nights to try an alternative to the more expensive and traditional Oriental with which I was familiar.
reviews.title: Near Perfect Stay at the Peninsula

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My arrival by limousine from the airport was flawlessly orchestrated despite considerable flight delay, the hotel driver provided chilled water and a cold towel. The check in was slightly confusing as it was conducted in-room, by a woman who seemed to know little about the hotel and couldn't take payment. I sorted this confusion out at the front desk and settled into the room.
reviews.title: Great hotel with improvement

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I chose a Grand Balcony room and it was well worth it. The balcony on a high floor of the building affords a view looking across the river towards the city centre that you will get from no other hotel.
reviews.title: Old School Luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: The room was well appointed, if a little full of nooks and crannies and equipped with a most illogical lighting and audio system. The decor was a little on the traditional side, but pleasant enough.
reviews.title: Not good enough !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool is a nice feature of this hotel, with multiple level interconnected swimming pools all served by excellent pool attendants. A small poolside restaurant served tasty light food and cocktails.
reviews.title: A lovely hotel in a lovely location

description: Developed as one of the finest hotel properties in Bangkok, its riverside location inspired the W-shaped design, capitalising on the uninterrupted panoramic views from every room and adding a distinctive architectural statement to the Bangkok skyline. The Peninsula Bangkok offers commanding city views, luxurious comfort, sophisticated facilities, extraordinary dining options and the legendary Peninsula service.
